Turns until this unit is fully replenished:
Drop Artillery or Engines||Drops your current siege engine or artillery piece.
Board Ship||Your troops carry out a boarding action against the enemy ship.
Loose Spacing||Loose spacing minimises casualties when under heavy fire, but makes the unit more vulnerable in melee and to charges.
Toggle Guard Mode||This will put your troops on the defensive. Guard mode makes your unit hold position. Even if an enemy unit routs, it will remain in position and hold the line.
Toggle Mount||Mounted units will need to dismount to completely capture victory points.
Drop Siege Equipment||Drops your current siege equipment.
Only acts on targets when in area

Toggle fire-at-will||Fire-at-will allows units to fire at enemies within range whenever they see fit. The effort of constantly firing and reloading quickly tires your troops, they will use their ammunition quickly, but not wisely.
Formation attack||The unit will try to stay in formation when in melee. Melee defence will be slightly increased.
Toggle Loose Formation||Loose formation spreads units out, making them much harder to hit with missiles, but greatly reduces their ability to resist charges.
Toggle Fire On/Off||When toggled off, the selected ship will stop firing and be unable to fire until toggled on again.
Release Animals||Unleash the beasts of war! The animals can only be released when you are close enough to the enemy, and will attack the closest unit to them.

Toggle skirmish mode||In skirmish mode, units will keep a safe distance from the enemy. Skirmish tactics can be employed to slow an advancing enemy or distract specific units. Skirmish units are vulnerable to cavalry charges.

Protective Stance||Your units will assume a defensive position, and will attempt to retreat if things get out of control.\\n\\nThis stance is usually more effective when you have missile superiority.\\n\\nExpect lower casualties on both sides.

Aggressive Stance||Your units will try to rush the enemy. This stance is usually more effective when the enemy has missile superiority.\\n\\nRetreat will be more difficult for both sides.\\n\\nExpect higher casualties.
Balanced Stance||When using the balanced battle stance, units will receive no bonuses or penalties.

Enemy forces have their AI disabled, but automatic behaviours such as melee combat reactions and fire-at-will still behave as normal.
Enemy forces have poor reaction times.\\n Thus making them easier to defeat.
Your faction will gain [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]control and [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep bonuses, and enemy armies may attack rashly when you outnumber them.
Enemy forces have very low reaction times, making them easier to defeat.
Your faction will gain [[img:icon_public_order]][[/img]]control and [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep bonuses, and enemy armies may attack rashly when you outnumber them.
Enemy forces have lower reaction times.\\n Will try and evade Spells.\\n Offering a reasonable level of challenge.
Enemy factions are not affected by significant penalties or bonuses and plan their moves with greater care.
Enemy forces have low reaction times but try to evade Spells and offer a reasonable level of challenge.
Enemy factions are not affected by significant penalties or bonuses and plan their moves with greater care.

Enemy forces are smarter, have decent reaction times.\\n Have a basic ranged targeting selection by differentiating between soft and armoured targets.\\n Will try and evade Spells.\\n Good tactics are essential.
Enemy factions pay less for [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep and unit recruitment along with various additional bonuses.
Enemy forces have normal reaction times and are smarter. They will try to evade Spells and use basic ranged targeting selection by differentiating between soft and armoured targets.
Enemy factions pay less for [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep and unit recruitment along with various additional bonuses.

Even the lowliest enemy soldier is formidable.\\n Enemy forces have good reaction times.\\n A robust ranged targeting selection.\\n Will try and evade Spells and Artillery projectiles.\\n  Prepare for the fight of your life.
With significantly lower [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep costs, enemy factions will field more armies and make swifter campaign progress while enjoying many other bonuses.

Enemy forces have good reaction times, making even the lowliest soldier formidable! They will try to evade Spells and artillery projectiles, and use robust ranged targeting selection to pose a higher threat.
With significantly lower [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep costs, enemy factions will field more armies and make swifter campaign progress while enjoying many other bonuses.

With significantly lower [[img:icon_money]][[/img]]upkeep costs, enemy factions will field more armies and make swifter campaign progress while enjoying many other bonuses.\\n\\n[[col:red]]Orders cannot be issued when a battle is paused.[[/col]]

You cannot load this save game. You are missing the following mods:\\n\\n

Armour Piercing||The damage of armour-piercing weapons mostly ignores the target's armour, making them the ideal choice against heavily-armoured enemies. They often inflict less damage in total though, making them less efficient against weakly armoured targets.
Bonus vs. Infantry||This unit inflicts additional damage and has an increased chance of a hit when fighting enemies that are man-sized or smaller.
Bonus vs. Large||This unit inflicts additional damage and has an increased chance of hitting enemies that are cavalry-sized or larger.

Directional Shield||This unit has a 360 degree [[img:ui/skins/default/modifier_icon_directional_shield.png]][[/img]]Directional Shield which blocks small arms missile fire based on which side the unit has been hit from:\\n\\nThe [[b]][[col:white]][[img:icon_missile_block_chance]][[/img]] Missile Block Chance[[/col]][[/b]] of each side is:\\n[[img:icon_shield_gold]][[/img]]%d%% at the front\\n[[img:icon_shield_silver]][[/img]]%d%% at the sides\\n[[img:icon_shield_bronze]][[/img]]%d%% at the rear

Flaming Attacks||This unit inflicts flaming attacks. Units hit by flaming attacks heal at half the usual rate whilst [[img:UI/skins/default/modifier_icon_flaming.png]][[/img]] 'on fire’ and sustain additional damage if vulnerable to fire. \\n It also adds a [[img:ui/skins/default/weapon_building_damage_modifier.png]][[/img]] [[col:green]]+50%[[/col]] damage multiplier against buildings.
Magical Attacks||This unit inflicts magical attacks which can harm units that are protected from regular physical attacks.
Shielded||This unit has a shield and will block %d%% of all small-arms missile fire hitting it from the front.

Blood-Ground Region||This region is part of an active Blood-ground. The number displayed indicates the Devastation earned from razing this settlement. Devastation is also earned by winning battles in the region.

Blood-Ground Region||This region is part of an active Blood-ground. The number displayed indicates the Devastation earned from razing this settlement. Devastation is also earned by winning battles in the region.\\n\\nCreating a new Herdstone at the currently selected settlement will remove this region from its current Blood-ground and add it to the new Herdstone's Blood-ground.

Defiled Blood-Ground Region||This razed region is in a Blood-ground where a Ritual of Ruin has already been performed, so is now Defiled. It cannot be colonised by any faction until the local Herdstone has been destroyed.

Defiled Blood-Ground Region||This razed region is in a Blood-ground where a Ritual of Ruin has already been performed, so is now Defiled. It cannot be colonised by any faction until the local Herdstone has been destroyed.\\n\\nCreating a new Herdstone at the currently selected settlement will remove this region from its current Blood-ground and add it to the new Herdstone's Blood-ground. If so, this region will no longer be considered Defiled until the Ritual of Ruin is performed again.

Current Devastation||This is the current Devastation already earned from the surrounding Blood-ground for winning battles and razing settlements within it.\\n\\nOnce Devastation here reaches 10, the Ritual of Ruin can be performed to convert all gained Devastation into [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination. More Devastation leads to more [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination earned, however.

Potential Herdstone Region||Raising a Herdstone here will create a Blood-ground and grant the indicated Devastation, and all marked regions will also be added to its Blood-ground. Razing settlements in Blood-ground regions will grant additional Devastation, which is also granted from winning battles within them.

Potential Blood-Ground Region||If a Herdstone is created at the currently selected settlement, this region will be added to its Blood-ground and the indicated amount of Devastation will be earned from razing it. Devastation would also be earned by winning battles in the region.
[[col:red]]This Blood-ground belongs to another Beastmen faction[[/col]]

Ritual of Ruin Available||A Ritual of Ruin can now be performed here to convert the currently earned Devastation into [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination. Once the ritual has been performed, other factions will be unable to colonise any ruins in the area until the Herdstone is destroyed.
Ritual of Ruin Complete||The Ritual of Ruin has already been performed for this Blood-ground. Other factions will be unable to colonise any ruins in the area until the Herdstone is destroyed.

Ritual of Ruin Unavailable||You are unable to perform a Ritual of Ruin here until you earn 10 Devastation.\\n\\nThe Ritual of Ruin will convert local Devastation into [[img:icon_marks_of_ruination]][[/img]]Marks of Ruination. Once the ritual has been performed, other factions will be unable to colonise any ruins in the area until the Herdstone is destroyed.

Fog||Reduced visibility. All ships and missile units fire with reduced accuracy and range, and enemy units are concealed by fog at long distances.
Rain||Archers may not use flaming arrows. It is more difficult to set fire to buildings and ships, and units take longer to recover from fatigue when idle.
Snow||Units take longer to recover from fatigue when idle.
Sandstorm|| It takes more to ignite ships, buildings, and deployable defences.

This settlement cannot be interacted with while devastated.

The Beacon is under attack. Kislevites loyal to the Motherland are within. Our army is small, but we can sway the battle if we are as wise as Ursun. We approach from the south, while Skollden's Northmen assault the barricades. Their backs are to us. We should take advantage.
The Beacon is safe. Many lives have been spared. The survivors look to me for leadership. I will need them, for the Wolf still lurks in the shadows.
The Wolf is cunning. He waited, knowing we would come this way. Now he means to face us in open battle with renewed strength. We deploy on the high ground and make him come to us!
The Wolf routs from the battlefield! He takes the remnants of his tattered force and flees north, into the wilderness.
While Khorne cares not from whom the blood flows, the Daemonic guardians of the Brazen Altar want it to be ours. Hungry for war, they will come at us directly. This knowledge must inform my strategy.
Who cares if my soldiers conspire and whisper doubts … I descend… and approach the Brazen Altar alone.

Dervingard was built to defy the Dark Powers and prevent another Great War Against Chaos. But the stronghold has fallen into ruin, blackened by those that defile its halls. It has become the den of the Wolf.
As the last enemy drew their final breath, a single ray of sunlight broke through the greyest of clouds. Dervingard was free.

Kurnz, once a Boyar of Dervingard, now a Warlord of Chaos, marshals an alliance of tribes dedicated to the Dark Powers. They will stop at nothing to prevent me from taking the Howling Citadel. The Chaos forces surround us – I must fight.
The traitor dies. The path to the Howling Citadel is open…

The knowledge to reach Ursun lies hidden in the Lucent Maze. The servants of Tzeentch defend it, but it's not them I fear. Mortals that enter the labyrinth rarely emerge with their minds intact. I pray Ursun protects me.
With Tzeentch’s forces scattered, I can walk willingly into the Lucent Maze. The knowledge within can lead us to the Howling Citadel.
Battle is upon us! The Wolf unleashes his pack of savages against Kislevian brothers and sisters. Save the Beacon and slay these northern dogs!
